level.ecm_name: Load Following applied to boiler and CHP
level.description: This control ECM enables to coordinate two HVAC supply components such that one of them follows the energy demand (up to its maximum capacity) and the other one supplies the remaining fraction of the load.

level.application: In many cases HVAC plants include more than one supply equipment such as CHPs, Boilers etc. The measure is applicable in several cases of refurbishment and system upgrades and enables to utilize the cheapest HVAC up to its maximum capacity as primary energy source.
level.advantages: More than one supply equipment can be used to fulfill the building demand thereby guaranteeing the thermal comfort of building occupants.
level.disadvantages: Utilisation of the HVAC supplying to peak demand may be limited (depending on system sizing).
level.links_to_barriers: This control ECM implementation requires hardware (such as timer, smart thermostat or BMS) and measurement system (temperature sensers)
level.boundaries: This control ECM is only applicable when you have two supply systems.
level.installation_data: Installation must be performed according to the BEMS installation guidelines
level.maintenance_data: Maintenance must be performed according to the BEMS maintenance guidelines
